intro: Achillea schkuhrii, commonly known as Schkuhrii yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, sunny soils. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to attract pollinators. Its foliage and flowers are also used in traditional herbal remedies.
